catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 350
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: landscape with some mountains at left and right and scattered buildings; waterfall in LRC; two walking figures, second panel from right, at bottom; two men in boad, LLQ; five-line inscription in black and three red seals, URC; tan paper backing
inscription: Poem on right screen: (Mulberry leaves are turning greener, / apricot and peach blossoms bloom as the season/nears the Ch\'ing-ming Festival of March. / I look for the spot where spring is at its height. / I rest my walking stick and listen quietly to the chirping birds. / Shunkin Gakujin)
markings: Shinsen no In |Both: Shunkin Koji | Right: Ganha Toho
medium: Ink and light color on silk
object_name: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair (right)
title: Spring Landscape
